post.summary: Create a manufacturing order operation row
post.description:
Add an operation row to an existing manufacturing order. Operation rows cannot be added when the
  manufacturing order status is DONE.

operation_id.description: If operation ID is used to map the operation, then operation_name is ignored.

type.description:
Different operation types allows you to use different cost calculations depending on the type of product operation
Process: The process operation type is best for when products are individually built and time is the main driver of cost.
Setup: The setup operation type is best for setting up a machine for production where the production quantity doesn't affect cost.
Per unit: The per unit operation type is best when cost of time isn't a factor, but only the quantity of product made.
Fixed cost: The fixed cost operation type is useful for adding the expected extra costs that go into producing a product.

operation_name.description:
If operation name is used to map the operation then we match to the existing operations by name.
        If a match is not found, a new one is created.

resource_id.description: If resource ID is used to map the resource, then resource_name is ignored.

resource_name.description:
If resource name is used to map the resource then we match to the existing resources by name.
        If a match is not found, a new one is created.

planned_time_parameter.description:
The planned duration of an operation, in seconds, to either manufacture one unit of a product or
        complete a manufacturing order (based on type).

planned_time_per_unit.description:
(This field is deprecated in favor of planned_time_parameter)
        The planned duration of an operation, in seconds, to either manufacture one unit of a product or
         complete a manufacturing order (based on type)

cost_parameter.description:
The expected cost of an operation, either total or per hour/unit of product (based on type).
Total cost of the operation on a manufacturing order is calculated as follows:
process: cost = cost_parameter x planned_time_parameter (in hours) x product quantity
setup: cost = cost_parameter x planned_time_parameter (in hours)
perUnit: cost = cost_parameter x product quantity
fixed: cost = cost_parameter

cost_per_hour.description:
(This field is deprecated in favor of cost_parameter) The expected cost of an operation, either total or per hour/unit of product (based on type).
Total cost of the operation on a manufacturing order is calculated as follows:
process: cost = cost_parameter x planned_time_parameter (in hours) x product quantity
setup: cost = cost_parameter x planned_time_parameter (in hours)
perUnit: cost = cost_parameter x product quantity
fixed: cost = cost_parameter

operator_id.description: If operator ID is used to map the operator, then name is ignored.

name.description: If operator name is used to map the operator then we match to the existing operators by name.

If you receive the items on the purchase order, you can mark the purchase order as received.
    This will update the existing purchase order rows quantities to the quantities left unreceived and
    create a new rows with the received quantities and dates. If you want to mark all rows as received and
    the order doesn’t contain batch tracked items, you can use PATCH /purchase_orders/id endpoint.
    Reverting the receive must also be done through that endpoint.

get.description:
Returns a list of variants you've previously created. The variants are returned in sorted order,
    with the most recent variants appearing first.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Filters variants by an array of IDs

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: Filters variants by a product id

parameters.name: material_id
parameters.description: Filters variants by a material id

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: Filters variants by skus

parameters.name: sales_price
parameters.description: Filters variants by a sales price

parameters.name: purchase_price
parameters.description: Filters variants by a purchase price

parameters.name: internal_barcode
parameters.description: Filters variants by an internal barcode

parameters.name: registered_barcode
parameters.description: Filters variants by a registered barcode

parameters.name: supplier_item_codes
parameters.description: Filters variants by supplier item codes. Returns the variants that match with any of the codes in the array.

parameters.name: extend
parameters.description: Array of objects that need to be added to the response

parameters.name: include_deleted
parameters.description: Soft-deleted data is excluded from result set by default. Set to true to include it.

parameters.name: include_archived
parameters.description: Archived data is excluded from result set by default. Set to true to include it.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Used for pagination (default is 50)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Used for pagination (default is 1)

parameters.name: created_at_min
parameters.description: Minimum value for created_at range. Must be compatible with ISO 8601 format

parameters.name: created_at_max
parameters.description: Maximum value for created_at range. Must be compatible with ISO 8601 format

parameters.name: updated_at_min
parameters.description: Minimum value for updated_at range. Must be compatible with ISO 8601 format

parameters.name: updated_at_max
parameters.description: Maximum value for updated_at range. Must be compatible with ISO 8601 format

post.description:
Bulk operation for linking variants with the default storage bins. 
  In case the default storage bin doesn't yet exist, it will be created and linked to the variant. 
  This endpoint can also be used for changing existing links of the variants to different storage bins.
  
  The endpoint accepts up to 500 variant storage bin objects.

requestBody.description: Linked variant default storage bin details

200.description: Linked variant default storage bin order
